content: super simple messy bun beanie original pattern design by debra brannon so you ve jumped on the bandwagon too the kids want one all your friends have asked you to make one the grands would look so cute in one and you may as well make one for the cat the dog ferrets chickens goats goldfish and chia pet while you re at it you ve looked everywhere for an easy one that won t take hours to complete you ve found it to add to the simplicity this will not have an ugly visible seam running down the back or side when this craze started i didn t have a pattern to go by but i wanted to try my hand at it as it just so happens hats are my favorite thing to crochet and i have at least 9 2 million designs floating around in my head at all times so here s my free contribution to the fad enjoy materials  bulky weight yarn i used loops & threads powdery for this example  us j-10/6 00mm and i-9/5 50mm crochet hooks i prefer susan bates® crochet hooks and all my designs are created with them  stitch marker or small length of contrasting yarn to mark your place  tapestry needle  button of your choice  salon quality elastic band/ponytail holder approximately 2 in diameter you can use the larger ones for thick hair but the yarn won t cover it completely and it might look a little wonky while you are working with it the band will stretch a lot further than you think it might without snapping trust me i have put them through rigorous testing prior to including them in my hats if you prefer not to use one i have included instructions to make one without it i use them because it provides structure and stability for the opening and will go right back into place even if you stretch it to the max finished size  adults 21 - 22 around gauge  first round 24 single_crochet stitches around elastic band = 2 5 page 1 copyright© 2016 debra brannon of trinity z trinketz you may use this pattern for personal use gifts & charity sales of finished product are permitted but designer requests that you link back to pattern and credit trinity z trinketz w/ the original design under the creative commons attribution-share alike license no part of this document may be reproduced or transmitted in any form by any means electronic mechanical photo-copying or otherwise without prior written permission from the author notes & other abbreviations  join ending the round - slip_stitch in both loops of the space indicated  repeat repeat - repeat the instructions starting at the asterisk *  prev previous  yo yarn over  skip st skip next stitch  blo single_crochet only in back loop of stitch  r1 round/row 1 -
